intro: Acinodendron racemiferum, commonly known as the clustered acacia, is a shrub native to parts of Africa and the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes many leguminous plants known for their nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and dense clusters of small, yellow flowers. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky soils. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it an important species in its native habitats.
